comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: Perhaps this is the R.J Collier, owner of Collier magazine and a 1910 Wright "B" aircraft. Reference here: www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/factsheets/factsheet.asp?id=666

comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: This appears to include Dr. J.C. Eberhardt of the Dayton Aeroplane Club. See NY Times article here: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9903E...

comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: All noted parties appear to have affiliations with aeronautical clubs or associations.  A significant convention of aeronatical clubs was held in New York City in 1910, though this photo may or may not depict that location or events surrounding it (reference website in comment above).  Eberhardt was named specifically in that NY Times article.

comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: This is William J. Hammer, an assoicate of Thomas Edison. He was an electrical engineer and aeronautical enthusiast. Reference here: www.nasm.si.edu/research/arch/findaids/findaid_index.cfm?... and with a photo to compare here: www.nasm.si.edu/research/arch/findaids/pdf/William_J_Hamm...

comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: Could this be C.J. Edwards of "C.J. Edwards and Son" as listed in the "1937 The Aeroplane Directory of the Aviation and Allied Industries"? Reference here: www.gracesguide.co.uk/wiki/C._J._Edwards_and_Son

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: You've brought up some good questions, encouragement.  The title for this record could be improved to match the captions and fill in the names a little more.  It's still not clear as to why this group was together, however, so we'll postpone making any other changes  until we get more information.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Here they are in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Joseph_Hammer en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Joseph_Collier By coincidence they are both written by me over a year ago.
